snippet: A scientific spacecraft whizzing out of control around the Earth may have failed because it was struck by some type of antisatellite weapon, the director of Russia’s space agency said.
abstract: Disabled Russian spacecraft Phobos-Grunt begins breaking up and falling to Earth; Vladimir Popovkin, director of Russian space agency, says vessel may have been attacked by some kind of antisatellite weapon, but does not specify who may have wanted such a strike.

byline.contributor: Kenneth Chang contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A scientific spacecraft whizzing out of control around the Earth may have failed because it was struck by some type of antisatellite weapon, the director of Russia’s space agency said.

headline.seo: Russian Official Suggests Weapon Caused Spacecraft Failure
headline.main: Russian Official Suggests Weapon Caused Exploration Spacecraft’s Failure
headline.print_headline: Russian Official Suggests a Weapon Caused an Exploration Spacecraft’s Failure
